unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Distribution of Race Times
question_text:
Jane and Joan are both on the track team and run the $400\text{-meter}$ dash.
Jane’s average time is $62.3\text{ seconds}$ with a standard deviation of $1.2\text{ seconds}$, while Joan’s average time is $62.5\text{ seconds}$ with a standard deviation of $1.4\text{ seconds}$.
If race times are approximately normally distributed, what is the probability of Joan winning the next race?
solution:
The distribution of the difference in their times is approximately normal with a mean of 0.2 seconds (62.5−62.3) and a variance of 1.22+1.42=3.4.

Standard deviation is the square root of the variance, which = 1.84.
